article.headline: Rider 77, Iona 62
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Jason Thompson scored 24 points and grabbed 16 rebounds Friday night to lead Rider to a 77-62 win over Iona in the opening round of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference tournament. The seventh-seeded Broncs (16-14) will play No. 2-seeded Niagara in the quarterfinals on Saturday. Justin Marshall scored 16 points and Devon Clarke added 10 for Iona (2-28). The Gaels completed their season with the fewest victories in the program's 62-year history. Their wins were over Rider and Delaware. Rider led by 13 at the half and withstood an early 8-2 run by the Gaels. Rider built its lead back to double digits two minutes later and Iona never recovered. Harris Mansell scored 18 points for Rider. The Broncs shot 48 percent from the floor and finished with a 37-32 edge on the boards.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
